docs.snippet: For decades, former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer was the technology giant's biggest cheerleader. His booming voice and energetic high-fives are famous around Seattle. Now that he's agreed to buy the Los Angeles Clippers for $2 billion, Ballmer is e...
docs.lead_paragraph: For decades, former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer was the technology giant's biggest cheerleader. His booming voice and energetic high-fives are famous around Seattle. Now that he's agreed to buy the Los Angeles Clippers for $2 billion, Ballmer is expected to bring that boosterism to the hardwood down south.

headline.main: Ballmer Brings Cheer, Competitiveness to Clippers
headline.print_headline: Ballmer Brings Cheer, Competitiveness to Clippers

docs.snippet: Mr. Katz, a prominent figure in Philadelphia political circles, agreed on Tuesday with his business partner to pay $88 million for The Inquirer, Philly.com and The Philadelphia Daily News....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Katz, a prominent figure in Philadelphia political circles, agreed on Tuesday with his business partner to pay $88 million for The Inquirer, Philly.com and The Philadelphia Daily News.
docs.abstract: Lewis Katz, philanthropist and co-owner of The Philadelphia Inquirer who had only recently emerged triumphantly in battle for control of the newspaper, dies at age 72.

headline.main: Lewis Katz, Victor in Fight to Own Philadelphia Inquirer, Dies at 72
headline.print_headline: Lewis Katz, Philadelphia Inquirer Co-Owner, Dies at 72

docs.snippet: The Los Angeles Kings almost went down in their opening playoff series. They flirted with elimination again in the second round. They went to the absolute edge of the offseason in the Western Conference finals....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Kings almost went down in their opening playoff series. They flirted with elimination again in the second round. They went to the absolute edge of the offseason in the Western Conference finals.

headline.main: Kings Advance to Stanley Cup Finals vs Rangers
headline.print_headline: Kings Advance to Stanley Cup Finals vs Rangers

docs.snippet: Jeff Francoeur and Jason Lane, veterans on the Class AAA El Paso Chihuahuas, see pitching as a way to return to the major leagues....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeff Francoeur and Jason Lane, veterans on the Class AAA El Paso Chihuahuas, see pitching as a way to return to the major leagues.
docs.abstract: Former major league outfielders Jeff Francoeur and Jason Lane, both veterans in their 30s, have found a second act playing for Class AAA El Paso Chihuahuas, filling in as pitchers; are hoping their new careers on the mound could bring about a return to the majors.

headline.seo: Jeff Francoeur and Jason Lane Look for a Way Back to the Major Leagues
headline.main: Pitching for Fun, and for a Future
headline.print_headline: Pitching for Fun, and for a Future
